alert.note: Alert for Curry County Coast; South Central Oregon Coast (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: High Wind Warning issued January 02 at 3:00AM PST until January 03 at 1:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 1 PM PST MONDAY... * WHAT...South winds 35 to 50 mph with gusts of 65 to 75 mph. Locally higher gusts are possible along capes and headlands. * WHERE...Portions of the South Central Oregon Coast and Curry County Coast, including the cities of Brookings, Gold Beach, Port Orford, Bandon, Coos Bay, and North Bend, and significant portions of US 101. * WHEN...From noon Sunday to 1 PM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds could cause tree damage and power outages. Travel will become difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Loose and unsecured objects may be blown away or damaged. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: People should avoid being outside in forested areas and around trees and branches. If possible, remain in the lower levels of your home during the windstorm, and avoid windows. Use caution if you must drive.

area.areaDesc: Curry County Coast; South Central Oregon Coast
